column4: is it possible to remove keyrings so that they are no longer used and not affect data / file access etc?
I think you just uninstall it with your package manager.
really? it's not like the data / apps being accessed when keyrings are used is encrypted or something? you aren't deleting encryption keys...?

I think uninstalling the programs will get rid of their effecting any data.  They may leave a few undeleted text files behind somewhere that were saved, but I'd bet that removing something that stores info locally would remove the info it stored, too, in most cases.
